Don't Spend Your Vacation In Traffic

Sanibel Mayor's Traffic Message
City of Sanibel Street Cams

The City of Sanibel's Street Cams are very reliable. On occasion, citizens have experienced problems on their personal computers or mobile devices viewing the cameras. In these cases to date, we have found that the issue has been which browser is being used on which device.

The following web browsers work best for viewing the Street Cams:

  • For an iPhone / iPad / Mac: Safari Browser
  • For a Windows PC: Internet Explorer
  • For an Android device: Google Chrome Browser
If you have any questions do not hesitate to contact us by phone email at citymanager@mysanibel.com or by phone at 239-472-3700.

The City of Sanibel wants you to enjoy your vacation. During peak season, Sanibel Island experiences daily heavy on-bound traffic congestion from 8 a.m. to noon and heavy off-bound traffic between 2:30 and 6:30 p.m. On a weekly basis during peak season, traffic volumes are the lightest on Sundays. To best enjoy your visit to Sanibel:
  • Avoid driving on and off the Island during these peak times
  • Plan in advance to travel around the Island by foot and bike
  • Stay on the Island - have dinner and shop on the Island to avoid traffic delays
  • Check the City of Sanibel website for real time street cams and traffic updates.
